skills.name: Reprieve
skills.Description:
Gain barrier and take flight. Total barrier loss or impact creates a 
cyclone
, healing allies, and dealing 200% damage per second.
skills.Notes:
Using this skill grants 20% of Seeker's maximum health as barrier. Flight ends when all barrier is lost, or upon colliding with an enemy or surface.
Additional barrier can be gained during flight to increase flight duration.
Compared to Sojourn, flight acceleration is massively increased and turn speed is significantly reduced.
Unlike Sojourn, Reprieve does not make Seeker immune to damage.
Like Sojourn, Soul Spiral orbs do not disappear during flight.
The cyclone has a 20m radius and pulls enemies toward its center, similar to 
Primordial Cube
.
At base strength, it lasts 4 seconds, dealing 100% damage and healing allies for 1% health in 0.5 second intervals.
For every second spent in flight, the cyclone's strength is increased:
Damage increases by 50%.
Healing increases by 1%.
Duration increases by 0.5 seconds.
This skill can be used to skip 
 Mithrix
's final phase by dealing damage on the earliest possible frame. To execute this, simply spawn a tornado on the center of the arena right before defeating his third phase.
Reprieve gains the following benefits with each stack of 
 Tranquility
:
Cyclone an extra 0.5 seconds.
Total duration of 7.5 seconds at max tranquility.

skills.name: Meditate
skills.Description:
Focus your mind to blast enemies for 300% damage, heal nearby allies, and gain 
Tranquility
. Reaching max 
Tranquility
 
Revives
 and grants 
Saving Grace
.
skills.Notes:
Heals nearby allies for 4% of Seekers maximum health.
Has a base blast radius of 10m.
Grants 25% of Seeker's maximum HP as barrier upon using the skill.
You have 5 seconds to complete the minigame.
Inputting the wrong direction deducts 1 second.
Failing to execute the timed sequences will increase the cooldown by 5 seconds.
The 7th stack of 
 Tranquility
 grants 
 Saving Grace
 to all survivors.
 Saving Grace
 increases all stats by 7%.
 Saving Grace
 will automatically revive Seeker on death, but not other players.
Every use starting at the 7th will revive all dead players that have not been revived by a Seeker on that stage yet.
You can cancel the skill by pressing [Special].




For each stack of 
 Tranquility
:
Blast deals +200% more damage.
1700% damage at max tranquility.
Blast heals +4% more of Seeker's max health.
32% health at max tranquility.
Multiplies the radius by buff amount.
As such 1 tranquility is still 10m
Max radius of 70m at max tranquility.

skills.name: Palm Blast
skills.Description:
Charge a piercing, spectral hand that deals 400%-700% damage and heals allies. 
Multihit
 three characters to gain 
Tranquility
 and barrier.
skills.Notes:
Heals hit allies for aÂ % of their max health.
Any excess healing is turned into barrier.
Unlike Meditate, this skill cannot revive teammates and it does not grant 
 Saving Grace
.
Successful multihits grant one stack of 
 Tranquility
 and 20% of Seeker's maximum HP as barrier.
Multiple multihits can be achieved with one Palm Blast. For example, hitting six characters will grant two stacks of 
 Tranquility
 instead of just one.
Hitting a boss with Palm Blast will instantly grant a stack of 
 Tranquility
, even if no other characters are hit. This includes boss monsters seen outside of Teleporter events.
Characters can be enemies or allies.
This skill takes 0.7 seconds to charge fully. Can be fired sooner for a weaker projectile
The charge can be held infinitely.
While charging, Seeker falls slower, similar to 
 Artificer
's Hover.




Uncharged shots deal 400% damage, heal for 9% and have 100% size.
Charged shots deal 700% damage, heal for 15% and have 150% size.
Both scale the same with tranquility.




For each stack of 
 Tranquility
:
Grows in size by 15%.
Total size of 205% / 255% at max tranquility.
Deals +250% more damage on hit.
Total damage 2150% / 2450% at max tranquility.
Applies +3% more healing to allies.
Total 30% / 36% at max tranquility.

False Son.description: The False Son is a slow but stalwart close-range warrior. With extreme health and defense, False Son can weather any storm. Use False Son's durability to stay in the fray and capitalize on his slow but deadly skills.

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.3 per level)
 1/s (+0.2 per level)
 0.6/s (+0.12 per level)

False Son.name: False Son

skills.name: Lunar Tampering
skills.Description: Every unused Lunar Spike gives +5% attack speed and +2.5 armor. Used spikes give +5% movement speed and +2.5 health regeneration.

skills.name: Club of the Forsaken
skills.Description: Swing for 450% damage. Hold the primary and secondary buttons to charge a slam for 1000% damage.
skills.Notes:
The base swing speed is 0.5 seconds per swing, with a 0.5 seconds recovery window. This recovery window can be cancelled by performing the overhead swing or starting to charge the slam.
The slam takes 1.3 seconds to fully charge. It has a 13m blast radius and a proc coefficient of 1.0.
Performing a slam before it fully charges will instead perform an overhead swing for 400% damage, which takes 0.9 seconds to perform.
The slam can be used even with 
Hooks of Heresy
, since using Club of the Forsaken replaces the Secondary skill to be able to start charging the slam.
Performing a fully charged slam in the air will cause the False Son to fall rapidly and slam once he hits the ground.
The attack gives the False Son slight upwards momentum before descending.
Falling for at least 0.5 seconds before hitting the ground after performing a slam upgrades its blast radius and its proc coefficient to 1.5.
Upon landing from an airborne slam, the player is bounced upwards for a small fraction of the distance they fell. Distance fallen is measured based on how much time the player spends in the fall state, allowing them to use certain methods such as Volcanic Egg to artificially increase their fall distance.
Can use Step of the Brothers while charging the slam without canceling it.

skills.name: Lunar Spikes
skills.Description:
Lunar Ruin
. 
Agile
. Throw a Lunar Spike for 200% damage. Gain more Lunar Spikes through 
Growth
.
skills.Notes:
Starts with 4 stocks at base Growth.
 Lunar Ruin
 increases damage done to enemies hit by 10% for 5 seconds and its duration resets with each stack, similar to 
 Bleed
.

skills.name: Lunar Stakes
skills.Description:
Lunar Ruin
. Fire a piercing, 
lightning
 infused Lunar Stake for 300% damage. Gain more Lunar Stakes through 
Growth
. Counts as 2 Lunar Spikes.
skills.Notes:
Starts with 2 stocks at base Growth.
Requires 2x as much Growth to increase by 1 than Lunar Spikes.
Lunar Stakes can pierce through enemies, but will shatter on contact with a surface.
Each enemy pierced by a Lunar Stake is hit with a lightning strike after a 1 second delay.
If a Lunar Stake shatters on a surface, an additional lightning strike will occur where the Lunar Stake shattered.
If an enemy dies before lightning can strike it, the lightning will instead strike where the enemy died.
Each lightning strike deals 150% damage and inflicts 
 Lunar Ruin
 on enemies in a 6m radius.

skills.name: Step of the Brothers
skills.Description: Dash a short distance, generating an explosion of 200% damage for every enemy hit. Two uses.
skills.Notes:
Can use this skill while charging or firing Club of the Forsaken and Laser of the Father without canceling them.
The explosion has a 10m radius.
Bug: Proccoeff is intended to be 0.5, but value is never set resuling in 1.0 instead.

skills.name: Meridian's Will
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Teleport and explode for 150% damage and pull enemies. Triple your passive's benefits for 4s. 
Growth
 increases this duration.
skills.Notes:
Teleporting grants 
 Energized Core
, which triples the effects of Lunar Tampering, for 4 seconds at base Growth.
Growth increases the buff's duration by 0.33 seconds at the same rate that additional stocks are added to Lunar Spikes.
The 
 Energized Core
 buff cannot stack, instead the duration is refreshed.
Can hold this skill to aim the teleport destination for up to 10 seconds. The maximum range is 35m, but you can move freely while aiming.
The teleport can only be aimed at surfaces and flying enemies.
The explosion has a 25m radius and the pull has a 15m radius.
The explosion has no proc coeffecient, but it can still deal critical strikes as if it does.

skills.name: Laser of the Father
skills.Description:
Charge a rapidly hitting laser dealing 240%-1400% damage for 4 seconds and refill Lunar Spikes. Increases in duration through 
Growth
.
skills.Notes:
Suffers from default projectile falloff.
Your movement speed is reduced while charging and firing the laser.
Deals 30%-175% damage per damage tick.
Takes 2 seconds to fully charge, but can be fired sooner at the cost of reduced damage.
The charge can be held indefinitely.
Can use Step of the Brothers while firing without canceling it.
Using Club of the Forsaken will cancel this ability.
Bug: This skill is almost entirely unaffected by items that increase or decrease attack speed. For example, one stack of 
Soldier's Syringe
 only increases its firerate by 0.56%.

skills.name: Laser Burst
skills.Description:
Fire a piercing laser for 1250% damage, refilling 50% Lunar Spikes. Increases in stock by 
Growth
.
skills.Notes:
Has no charge time.
Requires 4x as much Growth to increase by 1 than Lunar Spikes.

CHEF.description: A survivor of high class, CHEF specialises in only the most exquisite meals and combos. As a culinary master, CHEF uses a variety of practiced skills in tandem for additional benefits.

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.3 per level)
 1/s (+0.2 per level)
 0.6/s (+0.12 per level)

CHEF.name: CHEF

skills.name: CHEF's Kiss
skills.Description: Killing enemies with 2 or more skills cooks them up and drops a healing food item.
skills.Notes: Each food item heals 8% of CHEF's maximum health.

skills.name: Dice
skills.Description: Throw a piercing cleaver through enemies for 200% damage. Holding the attack doubles recall damage.
skills.Notes:
Suspended cleavers deal 40% damage every 0.4 seconds.
Holds 3 charges.
Using the skill tosses a single cleaver forward, automatically recalling after it reaches its maximum range (55m) or hits a surface. When the cleaver returns to CHEF, one charge is instantly restored.
Holding down the skill tosses cleavers automatically and suspends them in the air, keeping cleavers suspended for half a second charges them, making them do double damage and have a higher Proc Coefficient while returning. Letting go of the skill recalls all suspended cleavers.
The cleaver can pierce through an infinite number of targets.
This skill can be used to skip 
 Mithrix
's final phase by dealing damage on the earliest possible frame. To execute this, simply throw a cleaver aimed at the center of the arena right when defeating his third phase, and hold it there.
Bug: When a cleaver is suspended, they have the damage of a regular cleaver the first time they hit an enemy, which is doubled if the cleaver is charged.

skills.name: Boosted Dice
skills.Description: Throws cleavers in all directions, dealing 400% damage.
skills.Notes:
Using 
 Yes, CHEF!
 transforms Dice into this skill. It turns back into Dice when this or any other boosted skill is used.
Boosted Dice throws 16 cleavers at once; 8 horizontally and 8 upwards diagonally at varied angles.
All of the cleavers from Boosted Dice are affected by the player's point of view, which makes it possible to hit more enemies by manipulating the camera.
The cleavers can pierce through an infinite number of targets.

skills.name: Sear
skills.Description:
Ignite
. Scorch nearby enemies for 600% damage.
skills.Notes:
The scorching beam pierces through enemies with a maximum reach of 30m.
Using Sear on an 
 Oiled
 enemy inflicts 
 Stronger Burn
 instead of 
 Burn
.
Hitting an 
oil pool
 with the skill sets it on fire, causing it to apply stacks of 
 Burn
 to enemies in contact with it.

skills.name: Ice Box
skills.Description:
Frost
. Launch ice cubes for 3x150 damage.
skills.Challenge: CHEF: It's Getting Hot In Here!
skills.Notes:
Holds 2 charges.
Each ice cube applies one stack of 
 Frost
 to enemies in a 3m radius.
Hitting an 
 Oiled
 enemy causes it to instantly become 
frozen
.
Hitting an 
oil pool
 with the skill freezes it, making it continuously apply stacks of 
 Frost
 to enemies in contact with it.
Bosses can be affected by 
 Frost
, but cannot be frozen, except the 
 Void Devastator
, 
 final boss
 and 
 False Son
.

skills.name: Boosted Sear
skills.Description:
Scorch nearby enemies and fire three fireballs dealing 700% damage. Flaming oil blobs leave ignited 
oil pools
 on impact.
skills.Notes:
Using 
 Yes, CHEF!
 transforms Sear into this skill. It turns back into Sear when this or any other boosted skill is used.
Hitting an oil pool with the skill sets it on fire, causing it to apply stacks of 
 Burn
 to enemies in contact with it.
Oil pools
 created/ignited by this skill are ignited with blue flames, which apply damage twice as quickly compared to normal ignited oil pools.

skills.name: Boosted Ice Box
skills.Description:
Freezing
. Launches 1 large ice cube for 1500% damage.
skills.Challenge: CHEF: It's Getting Hot In Here!
skills.Notes:
Cannot freeze bosses, except the 
 Void Devastator
, 
 final boss
 and 
 False Son
.
Using 
 Yes, CHEF!
 transforms Ice Box into this skill. It turns back into Ice Box when this or any other boosted skill is used.
The ice cube instantly freezes all enemies in a 15m radius on impact.
Hitting an 
oil pool
 with the skill freezes it, making it continuously apply stacks of 
 Frost
 to enemies in contact with it.

skills.name: Roll
skills.Description:
Stunning
. Charge the rolling pin to speed forward, dealing 300%-600% damage.
skills.Notes:
CHEF can charge the skill for up to 2 seconds. There are 3 charge levels; each charge increases damage by 100% and duration by 0.5 seconds.
Each charge also significantly increases CHEF's speed during Roll.
Each charge added emits a ring explosion around CHEF which deals 60%, 80%, or 100% damage depending on the charge level.
The skill's base duration is 2.5 seconds. At maximum charge, its duration is 4 seconds.
The first jump performed during a Roll has significantly increased height. The height increase is unaffected by the skill's charge level.
This jump can be performed in the air, unlike a typical jump.
CHEF gains an 
 Armor Boost
 while this skill is active.

skills.name: Oil Spill
skills.Description:
Twirl upwards then slam down, exploding with 
oil
 for 200% damage. Launch again by reactivating this ability before landing, up to 4 total.
skills.Notes:
Holding down the skill causes it to activate again up to three times after the initial use. Every subsequent activation has reduced launch height.
If CHEF instead times its uses of the skill to activate it again just as it hits the ground, it will be launched up the full height each time.
The initial activation can be used to gain height while already in the air, but the sequential activations cannot.
Launching at full height drops two globs, similar to Glaze's projectiles, that create 
oil pools
 where they land. If a glob hits an enemy, it will apply a stack of 
 Oiled
.
Every subsequent activation of the skill also creates an oil pool at CHEF's location, regardless of launch height.
Damage dealt by ignited oil pools has a proc coefficient of 0.1.
Additional movement speed increases the number of globs dropped.

skills.name: Boosted Roll
skills.Description: Bleeding. Speed forward while spinning cutlery to deal an additional 200% damage to all nearby enemies.
skills.Notes:
Using 
 Yes, CHEF!
 transforms Roll into this skill. It turns back into Roll when this or any other boosted skill is used.
This skill is functionally identical to the standard Roll, but while rolling, CHEF rapidly spins blades that rapidly deal 20% damage and 
 Bleed
 nearby enemies.

skills.name: Boosted Oil Spill
skills.Description:
Twirl upwards then slam down, exploding with activated 
oil
 for 200% damage. Launch again by reactivating this ability before landing.
skills.Notes:
Using 
 Yes, CHEF!
 transforms Oil Spill into this skill. It turns back into Oil Spill when this or any other boosted skill is used.
This skill is functionally identical to the standard Oil Spill, but 
oil pools
 created by the skill are automatically ignited or frozen depending on whether Sear or Ice Box is equipped.
Ignited oil pools created by this skill have blue flames, applying damage twice as quickly compared to normal ignited oil pools with a proc coefficient of 0.1.

skills.name: Glaze
skills.Description:
Fire globs of 
oil
 in quick succession, dealing 7x250 damage.
skills.Notes:
The globs launched by this skill create 
oil pools
 where they land. If a glob hits an enemy, it will apply a stack of 
 Weak
 and 
 Oiled
.
Hitting an Oil pool with 
 Sear
 or 
 Ice Box
 will make each pool inflict 
 Burn
 or 
 Frost
 respectively, all oil pools have a proc coefficient of 0.1.

skills.name: Yes, CHEF!
skills.Description:
Emit a blast attack dealing 400% damage, inflicting 
Ignite
 or 
Frost
. Boosts the next Skill used.
skills.Notes:
Using this skill emits a blast which deals 400% damage and inflicts one stack of 
 Burn
 or 
 Frost
 depending on whether Sear or Ice Box is equipped.
In-game, hovering over the boosted skill icons during a run will display the skills' boosted effects.

Operator.description: Operator is an evasive frontline commander. He uses drones as a force multiplier, leveraging battlefield chaos at opportune moments.

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.3 per level)
 1/s (+0.2 per level)
 0.6/s (+0.12 per level)

Operator.name: Operator

skills.name: Drone Tech
skills.Description: Start each stage with 2 drone companions.
skills.Notes:
Operator's drones will repair themselves automatically when downed, and cannot be scrapped.
Operator's drones can still be upgraded at a Drone Combiner Station by combining them with their standard drone counterparts.
The drone next in the queue for either of Operator's secondary abilities will hover at his side. The drone at his side will not use any abilities on its own until it is released.
Unlike regular drones, they will follow him into all Hidden Realms.

skills.name: Gunner Drone Mk 2
skills.Description: A customized gunner drone will spawn with you at the start of each stage. Automatically repairs when downed.
skills.Notes:
The main difference between CROSSHAIRS and a standard 
 Gunner Drone
 is that CROSSHAIRS' 
 ADMIN-OVERRIDE
 skill has a 50% damage richochet to the bullets.

skills.name: Healing Drone Mk 2
skills.Description: A customized healing drone will spawn with you at the start of each stage. Automatically repairs when downed.
skills.Notes:
The main difference between DOC and a standard 
 Healing Drone
 is that DOC's 
 ADMIN-OVERRIDE
 skill grants barrier instead of healing.

skills.name: Transport Drone Mk 2
skills.Description: A customized transport drone will spawn with you at the start of each stage. Automatically repairs when downed.
skills.Notes:
The main difference between CHIRP and a standard 
 Transport Drone
 is that CHIRP's 
 ADMIN-OVERRIDE
 skill can be used to pick up and move Chests.

skills.name: H3-11 OCR Custom
skills.Description: Fire a pistol shot that deals 150%-600% damage and ricochets on kill. Restores charge over time.
skills.Notes:
Shoots 3 times per second at base attack speed while holding down the primary.
Each additional primary charge increases the damage of the next bullet by +150% damage.
It takes 1.5 seconds to get max charges.
The bullets suffer from default projectile falloff.

skills.name: ADMIN-OVERRIDE
skills.Description: Command a drone to activate its Special skill. Can store a charge for each drone you control.
skills.Notes:
List of Drone Commands
Has a unique attack for each Drone type.
Drones inherit items when using their special abilities.
Drones combined via Drone Combiner Station give operator additional stocks of this ability, and a damage multiplier of 1 + 0.25 Ã— tier on that drone's admin override uses
 Gunner Turret
, 
 Squid Turret
, 
 Quiet Probe
, 
 Delighted Probe
, and 
 Best Buddy
 do not count as drones for the purposes of this ability.

skills.name: CMD-SWARM
skills.Description: Enter target-painting mode to command your drones to ram enemies for 450% damage. Critical Strikes also ignite.
skills.Notes:
Drones combined via Drone Combiner Station give operator additional stocks of this ability, however, do not provide an additional damage multiplier like the default secondary.
 Gunner Turret
, 
 Squid Turret
, 
 Quiet Probe
, 
 Delighted Probe
, and 
 Best Buddy
 do not count as drones for the purposes of this ability.

skills.name: Ascent Protocol
skills.Description: Command a drone to lift you into the air for a controlled fall to the ground. Can be reactivated to leap to another drone.
skills.Notes: Jumping during the ability cancels the flight, but does not remove the ability to reactivate it to grab another drone.

skills.name: FIREWALL
skills.Description: Command a drone to charge up a shield that blocks damage. Release to fire it forward for 200%-600% damage.
skills.Notes: Pushes enemies in the direction of the FIREWALL, and pushes Operator back in the opposite direction.

skills.name: Ejection Core
skills.Description: Launch a drone that knocks enemies into the air for 300% damage. Enemies are Nano-Bugged until they hit the ground.
skills.Notes:
Nano Bug
 increases damage taken from skills by 100%, split into hits that deal 120% damage each.
Effectively, this means that damage to an enemy under the affect of 
 Nano Bug
 will be done again through a quasi-damage over time effect.
Each instance of 
 Nano Bug
 damage is determined by dividing the triggering attack's damage dealt by 120% of the Survivor's current damage stat, into a damage pool. An enemy will then receive instances of the determined 
 Nano Bug
 damage until the pooled damage dealt over time equals the damage dealt by the original, triggering attack.
The final 
 Nano Bug
 instance of damage will not round up to the determined 120% damage value. If less than 120% damage is left in the pool, the final instance will instead deal whatever remaining damage is left in the pool.
Uses your currently equipped drone to activate the ability.
Lauches all entities upward, including Operator itself.
Each tick of damage dealt by the Nano-Bugged debuff has a proc coefficient of 0.5.

skills.name: Amp Core
skills.Description: Launch a drone that charges up by absorbing damage. After a short duration, it explodes, dealing 300-2000% damage.
skills.Notes:
Starts with 300% of your base damage stored.
This is not affected by crit.
Stores 150% of the damage dealt to it.
Explodes in a 8m to 20m radius, depending on charge amount.
Explodes after 2s to 3s, depending on charge amount.
ANY damage will charge up the AMP, including Operator attacking the core.
You cannot proc item effects when attacking the core.
Upon spawning, the core taunts enemies in a 14m radius, making them aggroed towards it.
Any new damage will likely re-draw aggro back onto the attacker.

Drifter.description: The Drifter is a resourceful survivor who's quick to claim every opportunity whilst gathering Junk to spend on powerful skills.

stats.Health Regen:
1.5/s (+0.3 per level)
 1/s (+0.2 per level)
 0.6/s (+0.12 per level)

Drifter.name: Drifter

skills.name: Trash to Treasure
skills.Description: Recycle. Gain stackable buffs by carrying Item Scrap.
skills.Notes:
Item Scrap, White
 grants +6% Movement Speed per stack.
Item Scrap, Green
 grants +3 hp/s Regeneration per stack. 
Regenerating Scrap
 counts.
Item Scrap, Red
 grants +30% Attack Speed per stack.
Item Scrap, Yellow
 grants -15% Skill Cooldowns per stack.
Bug: this passive is disabled if the 
Alloyed Collective expansion is disabled in the run.

skills.name: Blunt Force
skills.Description: Bash enemies for 170% damage. The third hit deals 350% damage and stuns enemies. Has a chance to drop Junk.
skills.Notes: Has a 40% chance to generate Junk on hit.

skills.name: Cleanup
skills.Description: Toss a volley of debris for 4x100% damage, as well as the random projectile in your bag. Can consume 2 Junk to bypass cooldown.
skills.Notes:
Drifter will have one of the following unique objects in her bag, which will be aimed directly separate to the volley of debris. The object visible in her bag will have a colored outline indicating its rarity and strength:
Common
Junk Ball: Stuns, deals 400% damage
Sticky Bomb: Attaches to enemies and explodes afterwards for 800% damage
Serrated Shiv: Deals 800% damage, inflicts 
 Hemorrhage
 on critical strikes
Molotov: Deals 360% damage, igniting enemies and leaving a lasting fire pool
Uncommon
Barrel: Stuns, deals 300% damage, drops $4 (scales with time) and triggers on-interact items, such as 
Bundle of Fireworks
Bubble Shield: Deals 300% damage, creates a shield where it lands that blocks both player and enemy projectiles
Broken Healing Drone: Stuns, deals 400% damage, and spawns a healing aura on impact
Scrap Crate: Deals 400% damage, explodes into a cluster of stunning bombs for 12x50% damage
Thqwib: Explodes for 600% damage and triggers on-kill effects, such as 
Gasoline
Bundle of Serrated Shivs: Deals 5x800% damage, inflicts 
 Hemorrhage
 on critical strikes
Legendary
Aurelionite Fragment: Stuns, deals 4700% damage on impact, spawns 5 gold nuggets for $15 each (scales with time), and triggers a spike attack where it lands, similar to that of a 
 Gilded
 Elite
Haunted Skull: Stuns, deals 2000% damage on impact, and summons several homing skulls for 8x600% damage
Bundle of Thqwibs: Explodes for 3x600% damage, each Thqwib triggers on-kill effects
Broken HAN-D Head: Creates a large explosion for 1200% damage that shocks enemies for 5 seconds, in addition to spawning a healing aura

skills.name: Junk Cube
skills.Description: Slam down a Junk Cube for 400% damage. Hitting a Junk Cube will launch it, impacting enemies for 400% damage up to 3 times before exploding for 800% damage. Can consume 4 Junk to bypass cooldown.
skills.Notes:
Each Drifter can summon up to four Junk Cubes at a time, if a fifth is created, the oldest one explodes.
The Cube can be picked up by 
 Repossess
.
Unlike other objects, no Junk will be generated when bludgeoning a Junk Cube unless a monster is hit.
Hitting the cube while aiming at an enemy will send the cube flying directly into that enemy. This is true even if Drifter is standing on top of it, allowing her to reach airborne enemies.
Activating this skill cancels downward momentum, allowing the user to avoid fall damage.
Hitting a monster with the initial slam can generate Junk
Unlike Cleanup, casting this skill using Junk will not change the remaining cooldown of the skill

skills.name: Repossess
skills.Description: Leap forward and bag a monster or interactable. Use again to throw your bag's contents. Captured objects are Bludgeoned.
skills.Notes:
Repossess can't capture bosses, but can bag Halcyonites.
Different interactables will weigh down Drifter differently when they're captured. The heavier a captured object is, the more it will slow her down and increase the damage of Bludgeon and Discard.
Light interactables, such as Barrels, will only weigh down Drifter a little and show a green slowdown marker.
Medium interactables, such as Large Chests, will weigh down Drifter a good amount and show a yellow slowdown marker.
Heavy interactables, such as Multishop Terminals, will weigh down Drifter a lot and show a red slowdown marker.
The same weight system applies to monsters, with the difference being that monsters are able to escape out of the bag if given enough time. The time it takes to do this depends on how strong the monster is.
Blazing Elites will continuously deal damage from the fire trail while bagged so Drifter should avoid grabbing them as it can easily deal fatal damage.
The cooldown for this ability starts on cast, but is paused if Repossess captures an object for as long as that object is held
Sprinting during the cast time will cancel the skill while refunding it's cooldown

skills.name: Bludgeon
skills.Description: Bash enemies with your bagged object for 280% damage that scales with the object's mass. Drops Junk and damages the object with each hit. Monsters break out after 3 hits.
skills.Notes:
1 Junk is generated per hit, however hitting additional monsters has a chance to drop more Junk
4 additional Junk is generated if the held object is destroyed
Allies such as drones and other players will not take damage nor drop Junk when bludgeoned, except for the Junk gained from hitting secondary targets
If the player has 
Visions of Heresy
, Bludgeon will not be replaced by 
 Hungering Gaze
.

skills.name: Discard
skills.Description: Toss the held object from your bag. Stun on impact and deal 280% damage that scales with the object's mass. Drops Junk.
skills.Notes:
4 Junk is generated at the landing location if the thrown object is a monster.
Certain objects apply special effects when thrown to deal damage. These effects take the place of the stun effect normally applied when throwing an object at an enemy.
If the thrown object is a 
 Lesser Wisp
, 
 Greater Wisp
, or Lunar Chimera 
 Exploder
 or 
 Wisp
, the enemy is 
 ignited
.
If the thrown object is a 
 Jellyfish
, the enemy is shocked.
If the thrown object is a Shrine of Order or Cleansing Pool, the enemy is 
 crippled
If the thrown object is a Void Cradle, the enemy gains 1 stack of 
 Nullify Stack
.
If the thrown object is a Lunar Pod, the enemy gains the 
 Lunar Root
 effect from 
Hooks of Heresy
.
If the thrown object is a Shrine of the Mountain, the damage dealt can bypass one-shot protection. This is only relevant when dealing damage to other players with the Artifact of Chaos or when an umbra from the Artifact of Vengeance throws a Shrine of the Mountain.
Sprinting during the cast time will cancel the skill, putting it on a 1 second cooldown

skills.name: Tornado Slam
skills.Description: Spin forwards, smacking enemies for 170% damage per hit with a chance to drop Junk, and then slam for 400%. Ricochets off of heavy enemies. Cancel with Primary Skill or by jumping.
skills.Notes:
Guarantees +1 Junk on hitting larger monsters.
Guarantees +1 Junk on critical strike.
50% chance for +1 Junk
Per skill activation it limits how much junk you get if you make too much.
If you've generated more than 12 Junk, you're limited to 2 per hit.
If you've generated more than 24 Junk, you're limited to 1 per hit.
Bounces when hitting large enemies, automatically bouncing Drifter in the direction of other large enemies.

skills.name: Salvage
skills.Description: Consume 8 Junk to spawn 4 temporary items.

skills.name: Tinker
skills.Description: Stunning. Consume 8 Junk to cast a shockwave for 100% damage that applies a random debuff and tinkers with an item pickup or item-holding interactable. Effects vary based on target.
skills.Notes:
Can be used to reroll the items in Multishop Terminals, 3D Printers, Cauldrons, 
 Void Potentials, and 
 Aurelionite Fragments.
The rarities of items in 
 Void Potentials and 
 Aurelionite Fragments will stay the same.
Can only reroll items up to two times.
Can be used on an unclaimed item drop to refashion it into a Temporary Item and an Item Scrap of its associated rarity.
Using Tinker on an item dropped from a 3D Printer will instead refashion the item into two Temporary Items, with no Scrap drop.
When Tinker is used in this way it has no effect on item rarities that do not have an associated tier of scrap. This essentially limits the use of it to only the tiers with an Item Scrap: White / Common, Green / Uncommon, Red / Legendary, and Yellow / Boss items.
Cannot be used on WorldUnique items, such as Pearls
Does not need to be targeted on an item to be used, but missing a target with it will still consume the junk needed to activate the skill.
Tinker activates as a wide, slow-moving ray that dissipates after few meters, which means it can be used on multiple items or interactables with one activation. This can be beneficial to scrap multiple items at once, or detrimental if several items are close together but only one target was intended. This is most notable when attempting to reroll a single item in a multishop.
Status effect list:
Slow 10%
 Frost
 50% Slow
 Tar
 60% Slow
 80% Slow
80% Slow
 (Debuff from unused equipment)
Jailer 100% Slow (Debuff from unused Void Jailer effect)
 Nullified
 (Rooting)
 Lunar Root
 (Rooting)
Vulture Root (Rooting)
 Beetle Juice
 Cripple
 Weak
 Weakpoint Destroyed
 (-1% armor)
 Nano Bug
 Fruiting
 Healing Disabled
 Accelerant
 Accelerant
 (Non functioning variant)
Conductive (Adds static visual, no gameplay effect)
Electrocuted (Unused icon for DoT (Non functioning)

Heretic.description: The Heretic is a powerful character who can only be accessed through extraordinary means.

stats.Health Regen:
-9/s (-1.8 per level)
 -6/s (-1.2 per level)
 -3.6/s (-0.72 per level)

Heretic.name: Heretic

skills.name: Nevermore
skills.Description: Squawk a solemn reply.
skills.Notes:
This skill exists in all four of the Heretic's skill slots, but is usually not seen by the player due to being overridden by the four Heresy skills that are necessary to transform into her.
Has no meaningful effect at all, emitting only a quiet squawk when used.
Can only be used if a Cleansing Pool, Shrine of Order or 
Egocentrism
 causes the Heretic to lose one of her Heresy items.

skills.name: Hungering Gaze
skills.Cooldown: 2s (+2s per stack) since the last shot was fired
skills.Description: Fire a flurry of tracking shards that detonate after a delay, dealing 120% base damage. Hold up to 12 charges (+12 per stack) that reload after 2 seconds (+2 per stack).
skills.Notes:
The initial hit deals 5% base damage.
Once the cooldown period is finished, all stacks are recharged at once.
Each shot will reset the cooldown period back to the full 2 seconds.
Changes the firing of 
 Engineer's
 turrets.
Replaces both of 
 MUL-T's
 selected primary skills. However, it does not replace the second primary while in Power Mode.
Picking up an Ammo Box from a 
Bandolier
 will grant the full capacity.
Getting a 
Purity
 will allow the player to only have a 0.5 second cooldown between shots.

skills.name: Slicing Maelstrom
skills.Description: Charge up a projectile that deals 875% damage per second to nearby enemies, exploding after 3 seconds to deal 700% damage and root enemies for 3 (+3 per stack) seconds. Recharges after 5 (+5 per stack) seconds.
skills.Notes:
Correction: The in-game description of 175% damage per second is incorrect. The blade maelstrom can hit up to 5 times per second, dealing 175% damage per hit for 875% damage per second total.
Charging up the projectile increases the initial launch velocity of the projectile, charging faster with increased attack speed. The projectile is automatically launched at full charge.
Once thrown, the projectile rapidly decelerates and will usually come to a halt before it explodes on its timer.
The projectile penetrates enemies and players but bounces off of terrain.
The ending explosion has a radius of 14m and applies the 
 Lunar Root
 debuff to enemies, rooting them.

skills.name: Shadowfade
skills.Description: Fade away, becoming intangible and gaining +30% movement speed. Heal for 18.2% (+18.2% per stack) of your maximum health. Lasts 3 (+3 per stack) seconds.
skills.Notes:
Correction: The in-game description of healing 25% max health is incorrect. Instead, it gives 1.3% max health per tick for 14 ticks, for a total of 18.2% max health per activation, per stack.
The player can fly during the skill's duration if activating it in midair.
The invulnerable period cannot be cancelled early.
While invulnerable, the player can still interact with things and activate their equipment, but cannot use any skills.
The player's hitbox is removed while invulnerable, so even a 
 Void Reaver's
 implosion can be avoided.

skills.name: Ruin
skills.Description: Dealing damage adds a stack of Ruin for 10 (+10 per stack) seconds. Activating the skill detonates all Ruin stacks at unlimited range, dealing 300% damage plus 120% damage per stack of Ruin. Recharges after 8 (+8 per stack) seconds.
skills.Notes:
Multiple enemies can be affected by 
 Ruin
 simultaneously.
The chance to inflict Ruin is multiplied by the proc coefficient of the attack, but it will always last for the full 10 seconds. Damage with a proc coefficient of 0, such as 
 Bleed
, will never add any Ruin.
All stacks of Ruin are refreshed when a new stack is applied to that target.
When the skill is activated, one shot is fired at each enemy suffering from Ruin. These shots penetrate terrain, and have a Proc Coefficient of 1.0
While the skill is on cooldown, attacks do not inflict Ruin.
Minions such as Drones will not inflict Ruin.
